author: Special Correspondent
text:
As many as 54 candidates, who were coached by the State-run All India Civil Services Coaching Centre, have cleared the Union Public Service Commission’s Civil Services main examination. They will be given a two-day training to help them pass the personality test.

The results of the main examination were released on Friday.

A total of 225 youngsters were chosen for the coaching programme. They were provided food during a three-month stay on the centre’s campus with a stipend of Rs. 3,000 from the State government.

Applications are being issued to the successful candidates for the training programme that will be offered by senior academics and bureaucrats, said M. Ravichandran, the centre’s Principal.
title: 54 govt.-trained candidates clear UPSC main exam
